pullRequest.body:
Make all the notations that unambiguously should inherit the docstring of their definition actually inherit it.

Also write a few docstrings by hand. I only wrote the ones I was competent to write and which I was sure of. Some docstrings come from mathlib3 as they were lost during the early port.

This PR is only intended as a first pass There are many more docstrings to add.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: Could you please fix merge conflict(s) and ping me on Zulip so that I review it before it rots again?

Otherwise LGTM. Thanks!
bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7715485596/job/21030169731)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7715485596/job/21030169234)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7715485596/job/21030168611)

```suggestion
@[inherit_doc]
scoped[MatrixGroups] notation "SL(" n ", " R ")" => Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup (Fin n) R
```
This is a field initializer not declaration, so it can have no docstring
Why not inherit the docstring here?
The original docstring explains two use cases which are then each wrapped in a different notation, although currently one of the notations is the general case which I'm not sure is what @urkud meant.

I wanted this notation to be restricted to `I : Box Î¹`, not `I : WithTop (Box Î¹)`. But changing this is probably out of the scope of this PR (though if you'll try to add `WithTop.some` and see if something breaks, it would be nice).
Okay that's what I thought. So you agree my docstrings are correct (if not quite matching reality right now)?
Actually, you do use it as a general notation below, so I'll inherit the doc for this one.

```suggestion
/-- The complement of a set `s` is the set of elements not contained in `s`.
```

No, it is defined as `â«â» x, f x â(volume univâ»Â¹ â¢ volume)` so that it's an integral w.r.t. some measure.
IMHO, you can say "it is equal to ..." but not "defined as". Same in the next 2 docstrings.
This came from the existing docstrings, which I have now modified too.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - doc: `@[inherit_doc]` on notations
